info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 6:44PM CDT until May 26 at 8:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Concho and McCulloch.
* WHEN...Until 845 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 642 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms from Millerview to to Eden, moving Southeast at 25 mph towards Melvin and Brady. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brady, Eden, Melvin, Salt Gap, Pear Valley, Doole, Lohn, Brady Lake, Millersview, Rochelle, Placid, Eola, The Intersection Of Us-87 And Ranch Road 2134, Fife, The Intersection Of Us-83 And Ranch Road 765, Us-190 Near The Mcculloch-San Saba County Line and Vick. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... White Street at Live Oak Creek, South Blackburn between Adkins and 13th, 17th Street between Pine and College, Hallum Draw, FM 1121 crossing Onion Creek, South High between 14th and 15th Streets, County Road 120 crossing East Cow Creek, FM 0503 crossing Waloope Creek, FM 1028 crossing Corn Creek and County Road 3053 crossing Brady Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT THIS EVENING
